intro: Gayophytum humile, commonly known as the dwarf ghost flower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pale blue or white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among succulent enthusiasts.
